content.description:
Originally started at Sculpture's Crack and headed right - but right to left is better IMHO...

Get up onto the first good hold and then make a tough reachy move (crux) onto the main rail - follow this to Sculpture's Crack, or continue past the Crack to the alcove finish with a strenuous and dicey move left and out of it.

Pin-scarred crack leads ominously to the long and strenuous lieback, although jamming could be employed, it's a race against time to the final (and cruxy) squirm over the top through the slot on the right.
content.protection: Top rope, bolts on top - inspect before use.
content.location:
Sculture's Crack Wall - see

Sculpture Crack Canyon West Wall. Routes L to R: Sculpted Crack 5.10c Carlsburg 5.11b TR Sculpture Traverse 5.10+ Sculpture Crack 5.10c TR Sand Blast 5.11c TR

.

content.description: The furthest left route on the Sculptures Crack wall.  Good holds to tricky pin scars with bad feet. Pull up to a slab with easier pin scars.
content.protection: No bolts on the top. Tree to the left is an ok anchor but its off to the side so just use it as a back up. Bring long webbing and some hexes and cams for the boulders about 20 feet back.  It takes awhile to set up.
content.location: The furthest left route on the Sculptures Crack wall.

content.description: Forty feet of strenuous climbing on flared pin scars up an overhanging wall.  There is a distinct crux through a bulge at mid-height--once past the crux, it's 5.10 to the top.  Fun, intricate climbing.
content.protection: Top-rope protected by cams and nuts up to 3".  Long anchor cord needed.
content.location:
The obvious line of pin scars just right of Sculpture's Crack.  For location, click

here
